title: CryptoRoquefort
author: CryptoRoquefort
content: Hello everyone! How are you? Today I come with a question about RBTC (RSK Blockchain). Looking for better options to the traditional BTC, I couldn't help but find RSK Blockchain. This is a BTC sidechain that leverages Bitcoin miners on a blockchain similar to ETH. Becoming the second most decentralized blockchain on the market and therefore secure. As this sidechain uses BTC miners, could RBTC (main crypto) be considered the best version of BTC out there? Let's keep in mind that this sidechain allows smartcontract, it has never been hacked and its bridge has never been breached either. Clearly it is better than any WBTC on ETH or other blockchain. What do you think?
